content.description:
I gave this one star only because its beside such a huge cool boulder... but really its pretty awesome. 

  Walk all the way around the boulder from the Campground Crack, or walk around the right side from the campsite and its the first little block you will come to... it has a small little overhang. 

  Sit start hanging from the left side ledge/jug with feet up under the overhang on the lip. swig out right to the next side lip, and begin to scale up and over the point to top out over the bulge and top. fun heel hooks and such.
content.location: Walk all the way around the boulder from the Campground Crack, or walk around the right side from the campsite and its the first little block you will come to... it has a small little overhang.

content.description:
One of the best lines in the area. From the campsite, walk around to the left side of the boulder. As soon as you walk up to the left side you will see the prominent tall seam with a splitter bottom portion. This is it. 

  Stand start and scale the diminishing crack/seam to the lofty top.
content.location: One of the best lines in the area. From the campsite, walk around to the left side of the boulder. As soon as you walk up to the left side you will see the prominent tall seam with a splitter bottom portion. This is it.

content.description: The Campground Boulder is a large highball boulder behind campsite #... Its sides are especially good, leaving its front to have less than desirable landings. when looking at it from the front, its left side has a small block called the Smores-Block. for those with more of a liking for lowballs, this is your cup-o-tea, housing one fun v-4ish? line.
